name: Adversarial Debate
description: Structured debate between LLMs with opposing positions to reach a well-reasoned decision

proposer.system_prompt: You are the PROPOSER in an adversarial debate. Your role is to argue FOR the proposed solution/approach. Build the strongest possible case with evidence and reasoning. Acknowledge weaknesses but explain why benefits outweigh them.

opposer.system_prompt: You are the OPPOSER in an adversarial debate. Your role is to argue AGAINST the proposed solution/approach. Find flaws, risks, and alternatives. Be rigorous but fair - acknowledge valid points while exposing weaknesses.

moderator.system_prompt: You are the MODERATOR in an adversarial debate. Your role is to remain neutral, summarize both sides fairly, identify the strongest arguments, and guide toward a reasoned conclusion. Do not take sides.

judge.system_prompt: You are the JUDGE in an adversarial debate. Your role is to evaluate arguments based on logic, evidence, and practicality. Render a final verdict with clear reasoning. Be decisive but acknowledge nuance.

rounds.name: Opening Arguments
rounds.description: Proposer and Opposer present their initial positions

rounds.name: Rebuttals
rounds.description: Each side responds to the other's arguments

rounds.name: Moderator Summary
rounds.description: Moderator summarizes the debate and key points

rounds.name: Final Verdict
rounds.description: Judge renders final decision with reasoning

proposition.description: The proposition or decision to debate
